params.name: input_star_mics
params.label: Input micrographs STAR file:
params.help: A STAR file with all micrographs to run CTFFIND or Gctf on

params.name: use_noDW
params.label: Use micrograph without dose-weighting?
params.help: If set to Yes, the CTF estimation will be done using the micrograph without dose-weighting as in rlnMicrographNameNoDW (_noDW.mrc from MotionCor2). If set to No, the normal rlnMicrographName will be used.

params.name: do_phaseshift
params.label: Estimate phase shifts?
params.help: If set to Yes, CTFFIND4 will estimate the phase shift, e.g. as introduced by a Volta phase-plate

params.name: phase_min
params.label: Phase shift (deg) - Min:
params.help: Minimum, maximum and step size (in degrees) for the search of the phase shift

params.name: phase_max
params.label: Phase shift (deg) - Max:
params.help: Minimum, maximum and step size (in degrees) for the search of the phase shift

params.name: phase_step
params.label: Phase shift (deg) - Step:
params.help: Minimum, maximum and step size (in degrees) for the search of the phase shift

params.name: use_ctffind4
params.label: Use CTFFIND-4.1?
params.help: If set to Yes, the wrapper will use CTFFIND4 (version 4.1) for CTF estimation. This includes thread-support, calculation of Thon rings from movie frames and phase-shift estimation for phase-plate data.

params.name: fn_ctffind_exe
params.label: CTFFIND-4.1 executable:
params.help: Location of the CTFFIND (release 4.1 or later) executable. You can control the default of this field by setting environment variable RELION_CTFFIND_EXECUTABLE, or by editing the first few lines in src/gui_jobwindow.h and recompile the code.

params.name: use_given_ps
params.label: Use power spectra from MotionCorr job?
params.help: If set to Yes, the CTF estimation will be done using power spectra calculated during motion correction. You must use this option if you used float16 in motion correction.

params.name: slow_search
params.label: Use exhaustive search?
params.help: If set to Yes, CTFFIND4 will use slower but more exhaustive search. This option is recommended for CTFFIND version 4.1.8 and earlier, but probably not necessary for 4.1.10 and later. It is also worth trying this option when astigmatism and/or phase shifts are difficult to fit.

params.name: ctf_win
params.label: Estimate CTF on window size (pix)
params.help:
If a positive value is given, a squared window of this size at the center of the micrograph will be used to estimate the CTF. This may be useful to exclude parts of the micrograph that are unsuitable for CTF estimation, e.g. the labels at the edge of phtographic film. 
 
 The original micrograph will be used (i.e. this option will be ignored) if a negative value is given.
